label: Description
value: Slender gallipot shape, with green and white dragon pursuing the flaming pearl, in aventurine enamel, on a blackground of blue, scrolled with silver wire. Neck and foot mounted in brass. Yellow counterenamel.

label: Description
value: Inrō (container) in form of a turtle, with tail and feet drawn in and head partially extended. Divided into four horizontal compartments fitted into each other and lacquered black on inside. Strung on brown silk cord with turtle-shaped Ojime 1952-164-24 and Netsuke 1952-164-25.

label: Description
value: Five sections, with an elephant and three flying birds in rubbed lacquer (togidashi), gold, silver, and red on black (ro-iro) background.  Inside gold nashiji lacquer.  Mounted with ojime 1952-164-36 and netsuke 1952-164-37. Bliss 11776, See 1952-164-32.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Head of a monkey, with gold eyes.

label: Description
value: Figure of a street vendor, wearing a sambaso hat and carrying a box on straps around his neck. The head is loosely set into the neck. Mounted with inro 1952-164-35 and ojime 1952-164-36. Bliss no. 1225. See 1952-164-35.

label: Description
value: Black lacquer inro, oval in section, decorated with gold waves and flowers. Tied and braided cord.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Rectangular box, with rounded corners, of wood. Sides and tops covered with applied flowers carved in mother-of-pearl and tinted ivory. Silver bands around edge of box and cover. Inside bottom "nashiji" (pear ground) lacquer.

label: Physical description
value: Shibayama technique carved mother-of-pearl and tinted ivory, silver, lacquered wood

label: Description
value: Cylindrical cup on three ball feet. Lower part, repousse shells and leaves; upper two thirds engraved with strapwork and scrolls with masks of crowned woman, turbaned, bearded man and faun. Three engraved ovals, with woman standing amidst waves (Aphrodite), a fairy-like winged woman, faun with thunderbolt.  Domed cover with repousse band of shells and leaves, and ball knob.

label: Description
value: Iridescent blue, purple and yellow. Free-blown body, depressed sphere in shape, somewhat squared in plan. Heavy, rolled-over rim from squarish opening, drawn irregularly down and attached to applied heavy double threads, accenting four “corners” of body, and diminishing to points, near bottom. Depressed center on underside.

label: Dimensions
value: H x diam.: 6 x 9 cm (2 3/8 x 3 9/16 in.)

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Iridescent blue, purple and green glass. Free-blown ovoid shape with flattened shoulders. Short neck, about one third diameter of body, flares slightly. Body decorated in upper half with bands of five rosettes composed of five applied drop petals each, in depressions, and entire band is edged by applied thread at upper and lower edges.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Mazarin blue damask with design of lateral rows of curving peony branches with diapered foliage alternating with floral vases. Faded pink and white satin selvages.

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 205.7 x 184.2 cm (6 ft. 9 in. x 6 ft. 1/2 in.); dimensions reflect three components stitched together.

label: Description
value: Brilliant yellow ground woven in cherry red with symmetrical design of alternating rows of upstanding floral shrubs surmounted by pairs of opposed birds. Wide yellow cloth selvedges. Lined; striped silk fringe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: plain compound cloth

label: Description
value: Green damask with a large flower in foliate scrolls with cornucopia-like shapes.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: 4&1 satin damask; background is the warp float face of the satin

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft (a): 91.5 x 54 cm (36 in. x 21 1/4 in.) Warp x Weft (b): 94.5 x 54 cm (37 3/16 x 21 1/4 in.) Repeat H: 100 cm (39 3/8 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Ex-collection: Mrs. George T. Bliss and Vitali Benguiat (see Benguiat Collection, Sales Catalog, American Art Association, February 25, 1905, no. 498.

label: Description
value: Apple-green satin damask woven with feathery serrated leaves forming parallel serpentine trails from which spring peonies and other blossoms in lateral rows. Striped pink and yellow selvages.

label: Description
value: Large pomegranates and baroque scrolls are decorated with colorful small blossoms in shades of blue, rose, pink and green.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metal-wrapped silk thread Technique: compound satin with supplementary weft

label: Description
value: Oblong panel of red velvet embroidered in blue, orange and metallic threads. Central motif has an Arabic inscription and is surrounded by a radiating floral pattern. Border in a stylized vine and flower pattern.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, metallic thread Technique: embroidered

label: Description
value: Red silk satin with all-over embroidered pattern of lobed ornaments and leaves, interspersed with small diagonal slashes. Lined with yellow silk taffeta.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, gold-wrapped silk core thread Technique: slashed and embroidered satin weave

label: Description
value: Tall flaring body with punched lambrequin motif above engraved shell and scroll band and initials E.H.S. Wavy relief band at top and bottom.  Flaring gadrooned foot, with traces of gilding. Interior gilded.

label: Provenance
value: 1952: acquired by Museum from Anonymous donor

label: Description
value: Coarse white satin with design in silver foil of horizontal-vertical continuous repeat of pointed-arm crosses in a continuous interlaced framework. Eight-pointed stars, formed by interstices, are decorated with tracery.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk, cotton, metallic foil Technique: satin weave

label: Description
value: Pleated cockade fan. Leaf of glazed cotton with silk cords attached--one to the upper center of leaf and the other to the lower center through a hole in the  tortoiseshell tube.  Pulling the cord at the bottom of the tube retracts the telescoping cockade fan into its cylindrical handle. The leaf, when pulled upward, has a circular or "flabellum" form.

label: Physical description
value: Glazed cotton leaf, tortoise shell handle, silk cord

label: Dimensions
value: H x W (open, without tassels): 27.9 x 15.2 cm (11 x 6 in.)

label: Provenance
value: Gift of Miss Mary Goodrich Fitch Beer.

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mary Goodrich Fitch Beer

label: Description
value: Three panels of chasuble of deep reddish purple fancy satin with large diagonal stylized sprig repeat in cloth weave on satin ground.  Narrow coarse twill selvages with greeen and pale lavender warp stripes.

label: Description
value: Skirt panel of deep blue silk with close-set, parallel serpentine flowering branches with small birds and large bouquets in between. Two selvedges, each with pink and yellow satin stripe.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: silk Technique: compound weave with supplementary warp

label: Dimensions
value: Warp x Weft: 96.5 x 53.5 cm (38 x 21 1/16 in.)

label: Description
value: Square of undyed cotton partially filled with sections of borders and designs, some suggestive of Renaissance symmetrical stylized plant borders and some fantastic geometrical symmetrial floral repeats. In faded multicolored silk and cotton floss.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: cotton, silk Technique: embroidered using long-armed cross, back and stem stitches

label: Description
value: Section of rep strip with wide vertical bands of plain red or green alternating with three bands made up of stripes of white, green, pink, red, brown, and blue. Each multi-striped band with central fancy cloth warp-surfaced stripe; scroll in two outer ones, stylized figure on center one. Two plain selvages. Corded loom ending across the top, hand-sewn hem at bottom. Flat gold ornament in stylized plant form caught on right center.

label: Physical description
value: Medium: wool, silk, metal Technique: complementary warps

label: Description
value: An engraved certificate awarded by Cooper Union to William McFaul who "attended the evening course of instruction in this Institution during the term beginning October 1st 1860 and ending April 1st 1961." Vignette of the Cooper Union. Signed by Peter Cooper as President, New York, May 22, 1861.

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Physical description
value: Engraving in black ink on paper

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Hunters on horseback lasso deer in foreground; on stone, near left center: "Ioan. Stradanus invent."; at lower right: "Car. de Mallery Sculp. Phls Galle excud."

label: Provenance
value: Ex. Collection: Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. The dogs hunt and trap the rabbits, left, brining their kill tot he horsemen behind the tree, at right. On a rock, left center: "Ioan. Stradanus invent. / Theodorus Galle Sculp." At lower right: "Phls. Galle excud." Below: "CALLIDUS EFFOSSIS LATITARE CUNICLULUS..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Hunters using captive leopards to capture rabbits. Horseman, left, has leopard seated on box behind him, other hunters on horseback, in background, right. Near lower left: "Ioan. Stradanus invent." Near lower right, on a rock: "Ioan. Collaert Sculp. / Phls. Galle excud." Below: "NON LEPORES CANIBUS..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
Crane Hunt using Cones, plate 28 in the Venationes Ferarum, Avium, Piscium series

label: Description
value: Horizontal rectangle. Trapping the long-necked bird by means of placing cornucopias in holes in the ground; the cornucopias are probably filled with bait. Several of the birds, rendered helpless by the hoods, are shown in center. Trappers behind tree, right. On rock, near lower right: "Ioan. Stradanus invent. / Carol de Mallery Sculp. / Phls. Galle excud." Below: "AUCEPS E CHARTIS COMFECTOS ARTE CUCULLOS..."

label: Credit line
value: Gift of Mrs. A. W. Erickson
